title: Face on Bruce Mau's Getty Books
content:
Trying to figure out what the title face is on the books that Bruce Mau recently did for the Getty. An example is here:   
 [http://www.getty.edu/bookstore/blowups/bones\_blp.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414142337/http:/www.getty.edu/bookstore/blowups/bones_blp.html)   
It may just be a version of Futura that was modified, just curious if it isn't.
author: benkiel

comments.content: Reminds me of [North Bergen](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414142337/http:/www.cubanica.com/font/nbergen/index.html), but the typeface on the cover looks bolder. Whaddayathink, Stephen?
a-HA, but there _is_ a [Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414142337/http:/www.cubanica.com/font/nbergen/index.html#)! Click "view alphabet & order info". Case solved!

North Bergen is close, but look at the lower case h, the counters are different. Same with the e. With the e I could buy that the differences was just a function of how the graphics were made, but the h has me wondering.

Actually, I'm full'o'crap. It's definitely not North Bergen. Uppercas "C" for example is waaay different. This is another case of jumping to conclusions [a tad too quickly](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414142337/http:/typographi.ca/cgi-bin/mt-comments.cgi?entry_id=476).
Isn't it just a messed-up version of VAG Bold?

seems like someone took Futura, mixed with some   
characters (S, s, t) from a grotesque font like   
Akzidenz and blurred the whole thing.

Naw. I know those oblong dots on the 'i's mean something.   
I just can't pin it down.
